Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • Course

  • public class Course
extends Object
    Defines a course at UBC, specified by:
    • its four-letter abbreviation and number;
    • its section number;
    • the term in which it is offered;
    • the days of the week in which it is offered;
    • the starting time;
    • the ending time;
    • the location; and
    • any pre-requisites/co-requisites.
    Author:
    Calvin Cheng

    • Constructor Detail

      • Course

        public Course(String abbrev,
              String section,
              int term,
              Day[] days,
              String startTime,
              String endTime,
              Location location,
              Set<Course> prereqs,
              Set<Course> coreqs)
        Constructs a new course.
        Parameters:
        abbrev - Four-letter abbreviation of given UBC course, followed by the course number (e.g. CPSC 210).
        section - The section number (e.g. "001", "912"). Labs may start with the letter 'L' (e.g. "L2G"), and tutorials may start with the letter 'T' (e.g. "T2C").
        term - The term in which this section is offered (1 or 2).
        days - The days in which this section is offered.
        startTime - The starting time in 24-hour HH:MM format (e.g. "08:30" for 1:30 pm).
        endTime - The ending time in 24-hour HH:MM format (e.g. "13:00" for 1:00 pm).
        location - The location of the section offered.
        prereqs - A list of pre-requisites required for the course. Can be empty.
        coreqs - A list of co-requisites required for the course. Can by empty.

    • Method Detail

      • hasTimeConflict

        public boolean hasTimeConflict(Course course)
        Returns true if the course has a time conflict with the given course.
        Parameters:
        course - The course with which to check for a time conflict.
        Returns:
        true if a time conflict exists with the given course.

      • getSection

        public String getSection()
        Returns the section number. In most cases, this is three characters long.

        Labs may start with the letter 'L' (e.g. "L2G"), and tutorials may start with the letter 'T' (e.g. "T2C").

        Returns:
        the number of the section.

      • getTerm

        public byte getTerm()
        Returns the term in which the section is offered. 1 represents a section offered in term 1, and 2 represents a section offered in term 2.
        Returns:
        the term in which the section is offered.

      • getDays

        public Day[] getDays()
        Returns the days during which the section is offered.
        Returns:
        the days during which the section is offered.

      • getStartTime

        public String getStartTime()
        Returns the starting time of the section. This time is represented in 24-hour, HH:MM format. For instance, 1:20 pm would be represented as "13:20".
        Returns:
        the starting time of the section.

      • getStartHour

        public byte getStartHour()
        Returns the starting hour of the section. This time is represented in a byte representing the hour portion of the time (e.g. 13:30 would return 13).
        Returns:
        the starting hour of the section.

      • getStartMinute

        public byte getStartMinute()
        Returns the starting minute of the section. This time is represented in a byte representing the minute portion of the time (e.g. 13:30 would return 30).
        Returns:
        the starting minute of the section.

      • getEndTime

        public String getEndTime()
        Returns the ending time of the section. This time is represented in 24-hour, HH:MM format. For instance, 1:20 pm would be represented as "13:20".
        Returns:
        the ending time of the section.

      • getEndHour

        public byte getEndHour()
        Returns the ending hour of the section. This time is represented in a byte representing the hour portion of the time (e.g. 13:30 would return 13).
        Returns:
        the ending hour of the section.
